p: According to the WHO biostatistical evaluations, obesity became a global health epidemic that is facing humanity today, and approximately 30% of the world population is diagnosed overweight. In addition, obesity is a widespread burden associated with many complications such as cardiovascular, diabetes, and gastrointestinal disorders. Actually, recent investigations on obesity have focused on hyperlipidemia and its role in weight gain. For that, the decreased intake of fat or reduce its absorption by inhibiting the action of lipase enzyme can affect positively in controlling obesity [ 15, 16].
